meanings.definition: To make modern in appearance or style.
meanings.sent1: The company decided to modernise their website to attract more customers.
meanings.sent2: She wanted to modernise her wardrobe by adding some trendy pieces.
meanings.sent3: The old house was modernised with a fresh coat of paint and new furniture.
meanings.sent4: His innovative ideas modernised the way we approach problem-solving.
meanings.sent5: The futuristic design of the car truly modernised the automotive industry.

meanings.definition: To adapt to modern needs or habits.
meanings.sent1: The school curriculum was modernised to include more technology-based subjects.
meanings.sent2: He had to modernise his cooking techniques to keep up with the latest trends.
meanings.sent3: The robot tried to modernise by learning how to do household chores.
meanings.sent4: She needed to modernise her communication skills to succeed in the digital age.
meanings.sent5: The company had to modernise its production methods to stay competitive in the market.
